Articles.Content:
I noticed that whenever I start up the game, the Mun title scene, where the Mun or Bust rocket is, will not show up, only the Kerbals orbiting Kerbin scene. I have some mods installed and I am not sure if that is affecting it. Does anyone know how to fix this? Thank you!

(Fixed, thanks to @tajwo, just edit the Kopernicus config and set the 'Disable Mun title scene' to false.)

Edited November 12, 2023 by Cytauri

I think that's by default. On startup the game only shows the scene with Kerbin in the background for the title screen. It often shows the scene on the Mun when you return to the main menu from a game. This is how it works in Stock. I don't know of any mods that change this.

Does the Kerbin scene still show up for you after loading a save and going back to the main menu? Do that a couple more times. Does it stay the same?

Edited November 12, 2023 by tajwo
Huh. Problem unsolved

Wait, it has not been solved. Just checked...sorry. It turns out that when I change it from true to false, Kopericus, annoyingly, resets it back to true. I do not know how to fix this.

6 minutes ago, tajwo said:

Huh. Problem solved

I think that's by default. On startup the game only shows the scene with Kerbin in the background for the title screen. It often shows the scene on the Mun when you return to the main menu from a game. This is how it works in Stock. I don't know of any mods that change this.

Does the Kerbin scene still show up for you after loading a save and going back to the main menu? Do that a couple more times. Does it stay the same?

10 minutes ago, Cytauri said:

Wait, it has not been solved. Just checked...sorry. It turns out that when I change it from true to false, Kopericus, annoyingly, resets it back to true. I do not know how to fix this.

I noticed this while reading some stuff about Kopernicus: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/blob/master/BandC.md

Quote

Known Bugs:

1.) Not exactly a bug, but worth mentioning: The Kopernicus_Config.cfg file is rewritten when the game exits. This means any manual (not in the GUI) edits made while playing the game will not be preserved. Edit the file only with the game exited, please.

Could this be the problem?

5 minutes ago, tajwo said:

I noticed this while reading some stuff about Kopernicus: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/blob/master/BandC.md

Could this be the problem?

Yes it was the problem! Thank you for helping me, TWICE! I will finally put the thread as fixed.
